sentence.text: Patient 1 had macrostomia, a cleft palate, maxillar and mandibular hypoplasia, sparse lower eyelashes and was reported to have problems with tear production (Fig. 1a).
On the right hand, he had preaxial polydactyly (thumb duplication) with syndactyly (Fig. 2a), and on the left, he had thumb aplasia (Fig. 2b).
In addition, overlapping toes and a low-positioned kidney discovered in the abdominal ultrasound were present.
